Englands slavery, or Barbados merchandize; represented in a petition to the high court of Parliament, by Marcellus Rivers and Oxenbridge Foyle gentlemen, on behalf of themselves and three-score and ten more free-born Englishmen sold (uncondemned) into slavery: together with letters written to some honourable members of Parliament. Rivers, Marcellus.
23, [1] p.
printed in the eleventh year of Englands liberty., London, : 1659.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Aprill."; "April 14". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
